title: Platform Modernization Initiative
description:
Modernize the platform architecture and infrastructure to improve scalability, maintainability, and deployment efficiency. This is a critical multi-quarter initiative that will fundamentally change how our systems operate.

Key objectives:
- Migrate from monolith to microservices
- Implement CI/CD pipelines
- Improve observability and monitoring
- Reduce deployment time from hours to minutes
design:
## Architecture Overview

The platform will be decomposed into the following services:
- **User Service** - Authentication, authorization, user management
- **Order Service** - Order processing, fulfillment
- **Inventory Service** - Stock management, reservations
- **Notification Service** - Email, SMS, push notifications

Communication: gRPC for internal, REST for external APIs
Data: Each service owns its database (PostgreSQL)
Events: Kafka for async communication
notes: Initiated after Q1 performance review. Expected to take 4-6 months with potential for phased rollout. Budget approved by leadership.

title: Design widget system
close_reason: Design review approved. Figma files shared.

title: Dashboard crashes on mobile Safari
description:
Reproducible crash when viewing analytics on iOS Safari. Occurs when scrolling rapidly through charts or when memory usage exceeds 80MB.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open dashboard on iPhone Safari
2. Navigate to Analytics tab
3. Rapidly scroll through charts
4. App crashes after ~30 seconds
notes: Customer reported this in production. Happens on iPhone 12 Pro. Stack trace shows memory allocation failure. Likely related to chart library not cleaning up properly.

comments.author: igor@example.com
comments.text: Reproduced on iPhone 12 Pro and iPhone 13. iOS 16.x affected.

comments.author: eve@example.com
comments.text: Looking into this. Suspect it's the Chart.js memory leak we saw before.

comments.author: alice@example.com
comments.text: Customer is Enterprise tier - please prioritize. They have escalated.

title: Memory leak in WebSocket connection
description:
Connection grows unbounded after 24h of operation. Memory usage increases ~50MB per hour. Issue only occurs in production with real traffic, not in testing.

**Impact:** Requires daily pod restarts to prevent OOM kills.
notes: Identified during production monitoring. Appears to be related to unreleased event listeners. Heap dump shows accumulating Socket objects.

comments.author: frank@example.com
comments.text: Found the leak - event listeners not being removed on disconnect. Fix in progress.

title: Login fails with special characters in password
description: Users cannot log in if their password contains certain special characters (specifically: &, <, >). Error: 'Invalid credentials' even with correct password.
notes: HTML encoding issue in the auth form. Password is being escaped before submission.
close_reason: Fixed HTML encoding in auth form. Added regression test.

title: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
description: Make platform accessible to all users including those with visual, hearing, motor, and cognitive disabilities. Achieve WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance across entire application.
acceptance:
- All images have alt text
- All form inputs have labels
- Color contrast ratios meet 4.5:1 standard
- Keyboard navigation complete
- Screen reader testing passed (NVDA, VoiceOver)
- Automated a11y testing in CI
notes: Legal requires AA compliance by end of Q2. Running full accessibility audit now.

title: Add ARIA labels to all interactive elements
Performance Optimization
description:
Improve application performance and scalability. Target: 50% reduction in page load time and support 10x increase in concurrent users.

Focus areas:
- Database query optimization
- Caching strategy
- CDN setup
- Bundle size reduction
notes: Performance degradation reported by multiple customers. P99 latency at 5s, should be <500ms. APM shows DB queries as main bottleneck.

title: Database query optimization
description: Optimize slow queries and add missing indexes. Expected to reduce query time by 70% for analytical workloads.
acceptance:
- All queries <500ms on production volume
- N+1 queries eliminated
- Indexes added with performance validation
- Query plans reviewed and optimized
- Slow query log clean (<10 entries/day)

title: Optimize N+1 queries in user listing
Update dependencies to latest versions
description: Security and maintenance updates for all npm packages. Review changelogs for breaking changes and plan upgrades accordingly.
notes: 22 packages have security vulnerabilities. Some require major version bumps.

title: Refactor authentication middleware
description: Clean up technical debt in auth code. Current implementation has multiple responsibilities that should be separated.
notes: Deferred pending completion of API gateway feature to avoid conflicts.

comments.author: kate@example.com
comments.text: Deferring until API gateway is done - too much overlap.

comments.author: charlie@example.com
comments.text: Agreed. Let's revisit in Q2.

title: Configure backup strategy
close_reason: Daily backups to S3 with 30-day retention. Tested restore procedure.

title: Should we use GraphQL or REST for the new API?
description:
Need to decide on API architecture for the new services. Both have tradeoffs.

**GraphQL pros:** Flexible queries, single endpoint, strong typing
**REST pros:** Simpler, better caching, more tooling support
notes: Need decision by end of sprint for planning purposes.
close_reason: Decision: REST for public APIs, GraphQL for internal dashboard. Rationale documented in ADR-005.

comments.author: diana@example.com
comments.text: GraphQL would be great for the dashboard - lots of flexible queries.

comments.author: frank@example.com
comments.text: REST is simpler for external consumers. Most of our customers expect REST.

comments.author: alice@example.com
comments.text: Let's do both - REST for public, GraphQL for internal. Best of both worlds.

title: Which monitoring stack should we use?
description:
Evaluating monitoring solutions for the microservices architecture.

Options:
1. Datadog (managed, expensive)
2. Prometheus + Grafana (self-hosted, free)
3. New Relic (managed, mid-range price)

comments.author: jack@example.com
comments.text: I've set up Prometheus before - it's powerful but requires maintenance.

comments.author: bob@example.com
comments.text: Budget allows for Datadog. Less operational overhead might be worth it.
